title: Inconsistent display of missing dependencies
author: igor2x
body_snippet:

comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
mRemoteNG is not software that is used by average computer user, but probably by some computer literate users, so manually installing two dependencies runtimes should not be major issue and this is only done once before program is used. Bundling is so less of importance.

Also "nice" looking dependency info is additionally not super vital, because this is again only only displayed at install time.

---

Maybe what can quickly be changed is the red "error" icon when Visual C++ Runtime is missing....
comments.author: igor2x

comments.snippet: Yes, that could be easy change to "Information" type, thanks
